abstract: Man dropped its 10.3 billion euro ($13.4 billion) hostile bid for the Swedish truck maker Scania after opposition emerged from Volkswagen, Scania’s largest shareholder, and will seek a friendly merger instead. Man, Volkswagen and Scania “see the industrial logic behind a combination” of the three businesses, but such a combination is not possible under the existing offer, Man said. A combined Man and Scania, the Swedish truck maker, would surpass DaimlerChrysler and Volvo as Europe’s No. 1 maker of heavy vehicles. Volkswagen, based in Wolfsburg, Germany, said it wanted to wrap its Brazilian truck unit into a Scania-MAN combination to compete with DaimlerChrysler and Volvo. Man is based in Germany.
